datafield.subfield: No tribute to England--No president for life--No Topsfield delegates, 1808:
t.p. (Hon. Daniel Kilham; Republican candidate for Congress)
A Fact. A gentleman who was a member of the General Court from Salem at the same time with Dr. Kilham, is ready to testify on oath, 1810.
Hist. collections of the Essex Inst., v. 49, 1913:

p. 222 (Daniel Kilham; s. of Daniel and Hannah Dodge Kilham, of Wenham; grad. Harvard 1777; studied medicine; apothecary at Newburyport; member of Mass. House of Reps. and Senate, governor's council; returned to Wenham ca. 1795; b. Jan. 15, 1753; d. Oct. 12, 1841, age 88)
(Kilham, Daniel, s. of Daniel, Jr., and Hannah; b. Jan. 15, 1753; buried Oct. 14, 1841, age 88 y. 9 m.)
Allen, M. The hist. of Wenham, 1860:

p. 145, etc. (Daniel Kilham; apothecary at Newburyport; justice of Court of Common Pleas, Essex Co.; justice of the peace 1808-35; founder of Amer. Acad. of Arts and Sciences; b. Jan. 15, 1751; d. age 88)
